block.p: Whitney Gay Lucas and John William Rosenberg were married on Friday by the Rev. Orlanda Brugnola, a Unitarian Universalist minister, at the Lotos Club in New York.

Mrs. Rosenberg, 33, is an assistant vice president for administration in the Impressionist and modern art department at Sotheby's in New York. She graduated from Vassar College and received a master's degree in visual arts administration from New York University. Her parents, Dr. and Mrs. George L. Lucas, live in Wichita, Kan., where the bride's father is an orthopedic surgeon at the Wichita Clinic and a professor and chairman of orthopedic surgery at the University of Kansas School of Medicine.
Whitney Gay Lucas and John William Rosenberg were married on Friday by the Rev. Orlanda Brugnola, a Unitarian Universalist minister, at the Lotos Club in New York.

Mrs. Rosenberg, 33, is an assistant vice president for administration in the Impressionist and modern art department at Sotheby's in New York. She graduated from Vassar College and received a master's degree in visual arts administration from New York University. Her parents, Dr. and Mrs. George L. Lucas, live in Wichita, Kan., where the bride's father is an orthopedic surgeon at the Wichita Clinic and a professor and chairman of orthopedic surgery at the University of Kansas School of Medicine.

Mr. Rosenberg, 34, is a portfolio manager at the Geneve Capital Group, an asset management concern in Stamford, Conn. He graduated from Tulane University and received an M.B.A. degree from Georgetown. His mother, Mildred Rosenberg of Greenwich, Conn., is a real estate broker there with Preferred Properties Commercial. His adoptive father, Robert Rosenberg, who is retired, was a partner in Modell Rolland & Company, a former New York investment firm. The bridegroom's father, the late Harold Mandelson, was a partner in White, Weld & Company, the former New York investment bank.
